metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15135 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
It was found that 389-ds-base since 1.3.6.1 up to and including 1.4.0.3 didnot always handle internal hash comparison operations correctly during theauthentication process. A remote, unauthenticated attacker couldpotentially use this flaw to bypass the authentication process under veryrare and specific circumstances.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15135` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1
389-ds-base - 1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1
python3-dirsrvtests - 1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1
python3-lib389 - 1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1').
